the rhinos were reportedly helped by protection and conservation measures in both india and nepal, giving the animals the needed breeding spaces and deterring poachers. a baby boom during the pandemic, when their habitats were closed off to tourists, also helped bump the numbers.
70% of the population of greater one-horned rhinos, aptly known by the scientific name rhinoceros unicornis, live in northern india, with the remainder residing in nepal.
